alert.note: Alert for Lebanon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL LEBANON COUNTY THROUGH 215 AM EDT... At 128 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Myerstown to Lebanon to Palmyra. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Palmyra, Annville, Myerstown, Campbelltown, Pleasant Hill, Sand Hill, Lebanon South, Cleona, Avon, Richland, Fredericksburg, Harper Tavern, Fort Indiantown Gap, Jonestown, Ono and Avon Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall of 1 to 2 inches per hour is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
